title: Could you use laundry detergent in a dishwasher? - Quora

Yes, you can use laundry detergent in the dishwasher, but you probably shouldn’t for a couple of reasons. One, using a product that wasn’t meant for the use of the dishwasher can impact the life expectancy of it as well as voiding the warranty on the appliance if it was purchased. Two, the products in the laundry detergent may not clean the dishes as well as actual dishwasher soap as well as it leaving residue after being cleaned. Furthermore, there are ingredients used in laundry detergent that should not be used on dishes such as fragrances, stain removers, and brighteners. Each have unique formulas created to work correctly when with the right appliance.

No. The reason we have different soaps and detergents for cleaning and washing is that each has a different purpose. There are special cleaning agents to remove food from your dishes and cutlery just as there are stain removers and water conditioners for your clothes. Then there's the foam factor. While HE detergent has a low sudsing action, there basically isn't any in dishwasher detergent. The former, therefore, would be inappropriate to use in a dishwasher.

My standard answer here is: Of course you can! There is NOTHING to stop you. The caveat: Should you? No way. It’s formulated differently, and you will end up with foam all over your kitchen, possibly living room/dining room and may end up damaging your dishwasher.

You should not do this because washing machine detergent has a higher concentration than dishwasher detergent and the result will be oversudsing which can cause leaking in the door seal, filter seal, vent seal, as well as damaged to the sump and drain pump. Not to mention, trying to get the remnants of the wrong detergent removed from your dishwasher, which is a painstaking and sometimes impossible process.
